Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

Seems to be due to day light savings - possibly related to this PR  https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/pull/12081

Update:

I tried the above PR change and it did not work as I expected.

I have since found this issue from last year that is working fine so far: https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/10430

@mikeyshing88 Thanks for reporting. We will see to it and find if we can make a PR based on #10430 's solution. You are welcomed to make a PR if you wish.
@kibbon Please check your demo and make sure it works. You may try jsfiddle if there is CORS problem.

I'm facing the same behavior. What is the trick to update the series data to get to the true sliding graph?

I have located the problem at the file barPolar.js,  it seems that the value of baseCoord is incorrect. based on the code, baseCoord = valueAxis.getExtent()[0]; Howerver I can't find out the correct  variable to replace it. If anyone solves the problem, please @ me and give me a chance to learn, TX!

So I tried just importing the map `import 'echarts/map/js/world';` and it worked.
